history.proof: intros p q H1 H2. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment p, q : nat H1 : q <> 0 H2 : 2 * square q = square p Unable to unify "2 * square q = square p" with "False".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall p q : nat, q <> 0 -> 2 * square q <> square p

Premises:
square = fun x : nat => x * x : nat -> nat Arguments square _%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
gcd_non_zero : forall d p q : nat, q <> 0 -> is_gcd d p q -> d <> 0
odd_even_lem : forall p q : nat, 2 * p + 1 <> 2 * q
sqrt_prime : forall p : nat, is_prime p -> forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> p * square b <> square a
sqrt_prime_irrat : forall p k a b : nat, is_prime p -> rel_prime p k -> b <> 0 -> p * k * square b <> square a
nat_factor_prime : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> n <> 1 -> {p : nat & {m : nat & {q : nat | is_prime p /\ m > 0 /\ n = power p m * q /\ is_gcd 1 p q /\ q < n}}}
sqrt_prime_irrat_aux : forall p k a b : nat, is_prime p -> rel_prime p k -> rel_prime a b -> p * k * square b <> square a
Nat.add_le_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n + p <= m + q
Nat.add_lt_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n < m -> p < q -> n + p < m + q
Pos2Nat.inj_mul : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat (p * q) = Pos.to_nat p * Pos.to_nat q
square_mult_lemma : forall a b : nat, square (a * b) = square a * square b
divides = fun a b : nat => exists q : nat, a = b * q : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
nat_factor : forall n p : nat, is_prime p -> n <> 0 -> {m : nat | divides n (power p m) /\ ~ divides n (power p (m + 1))}
Nat.pow_nonzero : forall a b : nat, a <> 0 -> a ^ b <> 0
is_prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall d : nat, divides p d -> d = 1 \/ d = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments is_prime _%nat_scope
Nat.mul_le_mono_nonneg_r : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> n <= m -> n * p <= m * p
mult_lemma3 : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m > 1 -> n < n * m
Nat.div_mul : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> a * b / b = a
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.mod_upper_bound : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> a mod b < b
Nat.mul_le_mono_pos_l : forall n m p : nat, 0 < p -> n <= m < -> p * n <= p * m
Nat.mul_lt_mono_pos_l : forall p n m : nat, 0 < p -> n < m < -> p * n < p * m
Nat.mul_succ_div_gt : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> a < b * S (a / b)
power_lt : forall p m : nat, 1 < p -> 0 < m -> 1 < power p m
mult_lemma6 : forall a b n : nat, n <> 0 -> n * a = n * b -> a = b
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.mul_id_r : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> n * m = n < -> m = 1
Nat.mul_id_l : forall n m : nat, m <> 0 -> n * m = m < -> n = 1
prime_square : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> divides (square a) p -> divides a p
prime_mult : forall p a b : nat, is_prime p -> divides (a * b) p -> divides a p \/ divides b p
Nat.neq_0_lt_0 : forall n : nat, n <> 0 < -> 0 < n
Nat.div_mod : forall x y : nat, y <> 0 -> x = y * (x / y) + x mod y
Nat.mod_add : forall a b c : nat, c <> 0 -> (a + b * c) mod c = a mod c
Nat.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p
Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
prime_gcd : forall d p a : nat, is_prime p -> is_gcd d a p -> d = 1 \/ d = p
Pos2Nat.inj_xO : forall p : positive, Pos.to_nat p~0 = 2 * Pos.to_nat p
Nat.div_add : forall a b c : nat, c <> 0 -> (a + b * c) / c = a / c + b
Nat.mul_add_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n + m) * p = n * p + m * p
BinNatDef.N.eqb = fix eqb (n m : N) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0%N => match m with | 0%N => true | N.pos _ => false end | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => false | N.pos q => (p =? q)%positive end end : N -> N -> bool Arguments BinNatDef.N.eqb (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.mul_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n * (m * p) = n * m * p

```  
intros p q H1 H2.
intros contra.
apply H2.
rewrite mult_comm in contra.
rewrite <- square_mult_lemma in contra.
rewrite Nat.mul_assoc in contra.
rewrite (Nat.mul_comm 2 p) in contra.
rewrite Nat.mul_assoc in contra.
rewrite (Nat.mul_comm 2 p) in contra.
rewrite Nat.mul_assoc in contra.
rewrite (Nat.mul_comm 2 p) in contra.
rewrite <- square_mult_lemma in contra.
rewrite Nat.mul_assoc in contra.
auto.
```

original: intros p q H1 H2. intros contra. apply H2. rewrite mult_comm in contra. rewrite <- square_mult_lemma in contra. rewrite Nat.mul_assoc in contra. rewrite (Nat.mul_comm 2 p) in contra. rewrite Nat.mul_assoc in contra. rewrite (Nat.mul_comm 2 p) in contra. rewrite Nat.mul_assoc in contra. rewrite (Nat.mul_comm 2 p) in contra. rewrite <- square_mult_lemma in contra. rewrite Nat.mul_assoc in contra. auto.
